trans-unit.source: On the on-premises machine, log on to the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link> (this is the old portal).
trans-unit.target: On the on-premises machine, log on to the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link> (this is the old portal).

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the navigation pane, select +NEW > App Services > BizTalk Service > Custom Create.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the navigation pane, select +NEW > App Services > BizTalk Service > Custom Create.

trans-unit.source: Provide a BizTalk Service Name and select an Edition.
trans-unit.target: Provide a BizTalk Service Name and select an Edition.

trans-unit.source: You will need to supply a unique name for your new BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: You will need to supply a unique name for your new BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Once the BizTalk Service has been created, select the Hybrid Connections tab, then click Add.
trans-unit.target: Once the BizTalk Service has been created, select the Hybrid Connections tab, then click Add.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new hybrid connection.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new hybrid connection.

trans-unit.source: Provide a Name and Host Name for your hybrid connection and set Port to 1433.
trans-unit.target: Provide a Name and Host Name for your hybrid connection and set Port to 1433.

trans-unit.source: The host name is the name of the on-premises server.
trans-unit.target: The host name is the name of the on-premises server.

trans-unit.source: This configures the hybrid connection to access SQL Server running on port 1433.
trans-unit.target: This configures the hybrid connection to access SQL Server running on port 1433.

trans-unit.source: If you are using a named SQL Server instance, instead use the static port you defined earlier.
trans-unit.target: If you are using a named SQL Server instance, instead use the static port you defined earlier.

trans-unit.source: After the new connection is created, the status of the of the new connection shows On-premises setup incomplete.
trans-unit.target: After the new connection is created, the status of the of the new connection shows On-premises setup incomplete.

trans-unit.source: Navigate back to your mobile service, click Configure, scroll down to Hybrid connections and click Add hybrid connection, then select the hybrid connection that you just created and click OK.
trans-unit.target: Navigate back to your mobile service, click Configure, scroll down to Hybrid connections and click Add hybrid connection, then select the hybrid connection that you just created and click OK.

trans-unit.source: This enables your mobile service to use your new hybrid connection.
trans-unit.target: This enables your mobile service to use your new hybrid connection.

trans-unit.source: Next, you'll need to install the Hybrid Connection Manager on the on-premises computer.
trans-unit.target: Next, you'll need to install the Hybrid Connection Manager on the on-premises computer.
